image.altText: Man depressed

props.synopsis: Men make up more than 75 per cent of all suicide deaths in Australia, but Lifeline says they only make up about 40 per cent of helpline service users — and even when men do seek help they experienced "high levels of disengagement".

title.children: Inquiry into male suicide rates hears men report feeling 'invisible'

image.altText: Outside the ACT Fire and Rescue South Tuggeranong.

props.synopsis: The baby boy — estimated to be less than 24 hours old — was found Thursday morning outside a fire station.

title.children: Police concerned for mother after newborn baby found outside fire station

image.altText: a herd of horses eating and grazing

props.synopsis: A widely criticised bill recognising the heritage value of wild horses in Kosciuszko National Park will be scrapped in a move celebrated by the Invasive Species Council.

title.children: Controversial 'Brumby Bill' recognising horses' heritage value dumped

image.altText: A close up of a goanna's face.

props.synopsis: One of a handful of Rosenberg’s goannas living in the ACT’s hill reserves has once again wandered off, prompting calls from a local conservation organisation for help bringing him back.

title.children: Rare goanna missing again from Canberra reserve

image.altText: Two people wearing dark blue scrubs walk away from the camera through a modern-looking hospital building.

props.synopsis: They were treated as "heroes and angels" during the pandemic years, but the number of occupational violence incidents against healthcare workers and staff working in Canberra's Health Services is steadily increasing, new documents reveal.

title.children: Increase in occupational violence against health staff and nurses

image.altText: A CEO with dark hair, glasses, looking serious.

props.synopsis: The federal government will expand a "lifeline" service for survivors of sexual violence, which advocates say is fully booked.

title.children: 'As traumatic as the assault': Expansion of sexual violence legal services

image.altText: A brown silo with the words Tarago written on it, with a street in its background

props.synopsis: Farmers near Tarago in southern New South Wales fear a proposed waste-to-energy incinerator could threaten their health and livelihoods.

title.children: Sydney's rubbish leaves farmers feeling like 'second-class citizens'

image.altText: A young girl walks across granite rocks covered in orange algae by the beach.

props.synopsis: Twenty years ago, Cape Barren Island was handed back to its traditional owners. Today's children are proof of the life-changing power of that act.

title.children: From $50 rentals to burying the dead, this island governs itself

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: There has been a shift in the power dynamic between Labor and the mining industry. This week's environmental law reform is its embodiment.

title.children: The power dynamic between Labor and mining has shifted

image.altText: Map of Sunda and Sahul, with arrows showing potential migration routes.

props.synopsis: A new genetic study has found Indigenous Australians travelled over two distinct routes, and 100 kilometres of open water, to reach the ancient landmass that would become Australia 60,000 to 65,000 years ago.

title.children: DNA study provides 'almost perfect correlation' for first Australians' arrival

image.altText: An 80-year-old woman looking straight into the camera.

props.synopsis: Decades on from Australia's forced adoption era, just two states have set up a redress scheme for the mothers who were harmed. Survivors are calling for South Australia to take similar action — warning time is running out.

title.children: Jo had her baby 'ripped away' at birth — she's one of thousands across Australia

image.altText: A student at Charles Darwin University heads to a 2016 graduation ceremony.

props.synopsis: The saddest aspect of all this that a generation of boys may feel compelled to suppress the ordinary the joy of celebrating another's success.

title.children: Angry, panicked men have built themselves a joyless, exhausting prison

image.altText: A rescuer with an orange helmet walks through chest-deep floodwaters towards two men down a flooded street.

props.synopsis: Parts of South-East Asia have been hit with record levels of rain as a cyclone hits Sri Lanka, causing floods and landslides, as the system heads towards India.

title.children: South-East Asia floods kill hundreds as cyclone hits Sri Lanka

image.altText: A man looks griefstriken.

props.synopsis: Many of the people who managed to escape the Wang Fuk Court fires in Hong Kong believe the disaster could have been prevented, saying they had flagged safety concerns more than a year ago.

title.children: Failed fire alarms and months of warnings — Hong Kong questions why 'so many died'

image.altText: Vladimir Putin

props.synopsis: Something has now been unleashed in Europe which is going to be hard to put back in the bottle.

title.children: Europe doesn't find the prospect of Russian aggression as funny as Putin does

image.altText: a severe storm cell sweeps over brisbane

props.synopsis: An ongoing heatwave along Australia's eastern seaboard will fuel further extreme weather this weekend, and its longevity is now breaking long standing records.

title.children: Hottest spring on record for east coast as dangerous weekend storms return

image.altText: Blue Wiggle Anthony dancing in the background with musician Keli Holiday at the front

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for the group says the band "does not condone" the use of drugs after a since-deleted video promoting Keli Holiday's single, Ecstasy, appeared on social media.

title.children: Wiggles issue statement after appearing in Keli Holiday Ecstasy video

image.altText: Six members of King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard pose in casual clothes in a suburban backyard

props.synopsis: Their rock, rave and orchestral music attracts a cult global following. But the prolific, chaotic King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard are just "at peace with failing".

title.children: Why King Gizzard defied Spotify, then embraced orchestras and raves

image.altText: Usman Khawaja leans back

props.synopsis: Under-pressure Australia opener Usman Khawaja is not swayed by the ICC's top rating for the pitch in the first Ashes Test in Perth, labelling it a "piece of shit" for the second straight year.

title.children: Usman Khawaja hammers Perth pitch after another bowling bloodbath

image.altText: McLaren Formula 1 driver smiles for the camera and gives a thumbs up after Qatar sprint qualifying.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri returns to form by qualifying fastest for the F1 sprint in Qatar, as he launches an unlikely bid to catch McLaren teammate and world championship leader Lando Norris.

title.children: 'Nice to be back' on top, Piastri says as he claims Qatar sprint pole

image.altText: A piggy bank, a toy home and a magnifying glass laid on a piece of floorplan

props.synopsis: We asked three financial experts about the up-front and ongoing costs of buying a home and for their tips on how to prepare for home ownership.

title.children: Think you're ready to own a home? Here are the costs to consider

image.altText: Blonde, teenage female students holding her violin and bow while listening to her teacher

props.synopsis: It is held up as the "gold standard" of music testing in the country, but there are claims the Australian Music Examinations Board is letting down talented students.

title.children: Parents fear music exam 'gold standard' slipping in parts of Australia

image.altText: A drone shot of a triangular facility made up of grey flat buildings at the northern tip of an island.

props.synopsis: Google's plans for a data hub could drag this remote island from a digitally starved past into an AI-powered future. But are the locals ready?

title.children: What Google's superhighway plans mean for locals on Australian island

image.altText: a man with grey hair and glasses speaks to reporters at a  press conference

props.synopsis: A Queensland government-ordered report on the use of puberty blockers and hormone therapies in the treatment of transgender adolescents is due on Sunday but might never be publicly released.

title.children: Queensland report on puberty blockers might not see the light of day

image.altText: Woman wearing blazer, yellow shirt and hair up sits with pen in hand at a desk with Aboriginal paintings behind her.

props.synopsis: For the family of Dunghutti teen Jai Wright, the guilty finding against police officer Benedict Bryant for dangerous driving occasioning Jai's death lifts a "weight off their shoulders". Legal experts say it's the first time a police officer has been convicted in relation to the death of a First Nations person in custody.

title.children: Hopes NSW court verdict might 'change the course of police accountability'

image.altText: Green and yellow parrot with blue wings in flight.

props.synopsis: Australia is the land of the parrot — few places in the world have such a dazzling array of colourful and clever members of the psittacine family.

title.children: Who's thriving? Who's barely surviving? A guide to Australia's native parrots

image.altText: Divers on a reef.

props.synopsis: Citizen science and AI have never been more important to the environment after White House cuts to USAID are felt beneath the waves, a new report says.

title.children: Conservationists scrambling for alternative funding after USAID cuts

image.altText: Shelves of branded cigarettes

props.synopsis: Police have seized about $8.4 million in assets, including two cars and a jet ski, and almost 1 million cigarettes, following an operation targeting the NT's illicit tobacco trade.

title.children: Police seize $8.4m in assets after alleged illicit tobacco raids in the NT

image.altText: A young mum smiles wearing her daughter in a carry.

props.synopsis: When Ali Gossage gave birth a second time, she did not experience the constant joys of motherhood. Instead, she was sometimes filled with "terrifying" anger.

title.children: Mother urges others to reach out after terrifying postpartum 'blackout rage'

image.altText: A hole in the brick wall of a hospital has been covered by a wooden panel.

props.synopsis: A new Royal Darwin Hospital would cost more than $1 billion to build, and likely take a decade or more to deliver. So who has the political bravery to commit?

title.children: Damage from Cyclone Fina exposes NT's need for new Darwin hospital

image.altText: A collage of images including missing boy Gus Lamont.

props.synopsis: The disappearance of Gus Lamont is one of those events that have a seismic impact on public consciousness: they distress, disturb, upset and unsettle. This week six mine shafts were searched, providing no further clues in the case.

title.children: Gus has been gone for 63 days, and multiple searches have yielded no clues

image.altText: Sydney Thunder player Sam Bates looks shocked at the end of a WBBL game.

props.synopsis: After rain falls for most of the Sydney Thunder's innings, umpires decide to call off their WBBL clash against the Strikers with Phoebe Litchfield one swing away from ending the game.

title.children: 'You can't do that': WBBL game called off with Thunder one swing from win

image.altText: Dressed in a dark suit and tie, Barnaby Joyce sits in a room, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The MP's resignation from the Nationals surprised no one, but drew ire from members of the party. Those on the ground in his electorate have a more mixed view.

title.children: Barnaby Joyce's kingmaker says he left voters behind in 'act of treason'

image.altText: Breanna Koenen and Jasmine Garner hold the premiership cup

props.synopsis: Wondering what time the AFLW grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

title.children: Everything you need to know ahead of tonight's AFLW grand final
